issues.description: Constructor signatures in the solution (Animal(String name, int age), Seal/Pig/Goat constructors taking two arguments) do not match the one-argument constructors implied by the UML/spec and used in the template’s Main (e.g. Seal("Clarabelle")). Students will be unable to compile or follow the example instantiation.
issues.suggested_fix: Align constructors with the UML and example usage: remove the extra age parameter from Animal and all subclasses so that each constructor only takes the name, or alternatively update all example instantiations to pass both name and age consistently.

issues.description: The solution’s Animal class introduces an int age attribute and related getter/setter not present in the UML or problem description (which only specifies a String name). This extra field diverges from the intended design.
issues.suggested_fix: Remove the age attribute and its associated getter/setter and constructor parameter so that Animal only has the name field as shown in the UML.
